messages.title: On Your Side in Reading East
messages.content: At this election there is a big choice to be made. Between Labour, on your side, and the Conservatives, on their side.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: A choice between securing economic recovery or 'immediate cuts' that will make life tougher for hard working families.
A bold action to protect home owners with businesses failures as a result owner payment, home repossessions and business failures have all been lower than in the Tory recession of the 1990s.
Making NHS safer and stands against any Tory threat to the local NHS.
Labour has funded major improvements at Reading Station - now under threat from the Tories.

issues.economy: A choice between securing economic recovery or 'immediate cuts' that will make life tougher for hard working families.
issues.education: Labour has funded major improvements at Reading Station - now under threat from the Tories.
issues.governance: It's a choice between securing economic recovery or 'immediate cuts' that will make life tougher for hard working families.
issues.health: Making NHS safer and stands against any Tory threat to the local NHS.

housing.content: A bold action to protect home owners with businesses failures as a result owner payment, home repossessions and business failures have all been lower than in the Tory recession of the 1990s.

leaflet.personalStatement: Dear Resident, It is a privilege to be Labour's candidate for Reading East. People are concerned about the way more politicians have behaved - and I'm not like them. That's why I want to make a positive contribution locally. My priorities for Reading East are...

endorsements.endorsement: Labour has really supported families with tax credits and the child trust fund and of course with huge investment in our schools.
There's no way we can trust the Tories with the NHS, or to keep things like the 38 bus pass and the winter fuel allowance, Labour is on our side.
Anneliese would be a excellent MP for our area.

quotes.text: Over the past three years I've been very impressed with Anneliese Dodds. She has a genuine commitment to working hard on local problems, has a real command of international issues and will make a great MP. We all need MPs in Parliament so I urge you to go out and vote for her.

images.caption: Anneliese Dodds at an event with families.
